oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Photograph of J. B. Killebrew
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Portrait photographs
Agriculture
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Image of J. B. Killebrew taken from the book, "Introduction to the Resources of Tennessee." The photograph was taken in 1871. The photo was taken in Nashville and the photographer was R. Poole. Killebrew appears to be middle-aged, and is wearing a suit. He has a beard and his hair is combed back. The book is volume one of a two-volume set. The book also contains an inscription from Killebrew to his son in 1875.
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: J. B. Killebrew
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: J. B. Killebrew was the first Tennessee Commissioner of Agriculture and an advocate of the "New South." He was the agricultural editor of the "Nashville Union and American" and espoused views such as increased immigration to the South, improvement of public education, development of natural resources for industrialization, and the overall improvement of agriculture.
